summary: In July 2022 I took on the role of CEO for WeMindTheGap, bringing with me 28yrs Public Sector, Community Sector, and Charity Trustee experience. I’m an accomplished transformation and improvement leader across public sector organisations with Board level experience in systems leadership, organisational and social system change.  I lead programmes which co-create change across organisations and communities.  Bringing proven methods and vast experience from transformational and behaviour change programmes to diagnose, co-create and  support new systems, process and behaviour changes to ensure sustainable change across whole organisations, systems and communities. Passionate about population health approaches, lived experience and intelligence led re-design of services which meet the needs of communities, supporting  services and organisations to re-imagine ways of working.

projects.description: An innovative way to promote health and wellbeing and capture what it means to people across the North West
projects.title: Life Through the lens photography competition

projects.description: The Frodsham Young People Life through the Lens competition is being launched to inspire young people from the ages of 2½ to 18 to take a good look at the world around them. Using the art of photography we are asking them to capture images which depict any one of the Five Ways to Wellbeing - connect, be active, take notice, keep learning and give.
projects.title: Frodsham Young People Life Through The Lens photography competition

projects.description: This project was about bringing together Large Scale Change methodologies and 5 Ways to Wellbeing to create leadership to improve the health and wellbeing of NHS staff.  Working with leaders in HR from many different NHS organisations, including CCGs and Acute Trusts, we worked with leaders to inspire innovation and improvement actions for organisations and created a Dragons Den opportunity to provide a platform for innovative ideas.  Throughout the project we have offered personal coaching on LSC and 5 Ways to Wellbeing to help leaders of further and fast on their change programmes
projects.title: Creating Leadership for Transformational Change in NHS Staff Health and Wellbeing

projects.description: Short leadership programme for Practice Nurses across Vale Royal and South Cheshire CCGs. Programme uses 5 Ways to Wellbeing as the framework and Large Scale Change techniques to enhance and maximise role of Practice Nurses to be leaders of community wellbeing. Inspiring results to date.
projects.title: Inspiring innovation, integration and leadership through health and well being‏

headline: Chief Executive Officer at WeMindTheGap

message.text:
Donations welcomed!

One of our  WeMindTheGap Employer Partners Valto and our First Mate Jim Ellison are taking on the National 3 Peaks Challenge this weekend!

📣A few are also getting their legs waxed today to add to the ‘donation attraction’! 📣

Please help us help them reach their goal of £5k!

All funds will enable WeMindTheGap to take young people on outdoor experience activities that they have never tried before!

Please donate below :-)

1 day to go!! 

Tomorrow the Valto team will be taking on the 3 Peaks Challenge in support of charity WeMindTheGap. 

We have raised £4,175 of our £5,000 target so far, and we are determined to reach our goal! 

Dougie Wood (MVP), Hugh Valentine and David Buckley are even getting their legs waxed today for the cause 😂 

Any donations you can spare for this amazing charity would be very appreciated, link to donate is here: https://lnkd.in/exu768GN

Good luck team Valto!

Another post on the importance of ‘Belonging’, and I’m not apologising that I keep coming back to this!

With belonging, comes purpose, structure, opportunity, ownership, loyalty, trust, love and care!

Yesterday I spent the most amazing two hours with the inspirational Annabel Turpin CEO of Storyhouse and Sian Hughes our  WeMindTheGap lead for our #Alumni WeBelong.

Within the first few minutes, Annabel had shared her passion on how Arts & Culture can nurture, support and create ‘Belonging’ with and for people, build social capital for them and for communities.   

At the word ‘Belonging’ I knew we were going to get on! I know we will create great opportunities together and with others, as we share the same values.

Please take a look at their #Agency Programme in the community of Lache, taking arts and culture into the hearts of communities and supporting young people in the most amazing way #employability #entrepreneurs.

https://lnkd.in/dqFn8zxq

Then today!  I attended the PSR Gogledd Cymru | North Wales RSP  conference and was inspired to hear the panel of speakers Craig Weeks Alwen Williams Nia Bennett Mike Learmond and David Roberts all state the importance of ‘Belonging’ in the culture of organisations and supporting a healthy and happy workforce.  

Belonging = Purpose, structure, contribution, ownership, opportunities, trust, pride, value, love and care.  And my new word from yesterday Agency! 

#inspiringweek #collaboration #belonging

Here I am again, shouting about ‘Belonging’, however, the Prime Minister said it at least 5 times this morning at his Key Note  speech on Welfare Reform at the The Centre for Social Justice    

I think we’ve started a new movement for good through the importance of understanding the impact of ‘Belonging’ Ken Perry clare budden Brian Laing Liz Grieve Sarah Harvey Nina Ruddle :-)

What a good event to also meet other charities like OFFICIAL CatZero Humber and their Partnership & Development Manager Pete Tighe, take a look at what they do, I look forward to meeting up again soon.

Also, thanks to Andy Cook, CEO of The Centre for Social Justice for spending time talking to us about our work, ideas and opportunities and the impact of what we do and our Big Conversation.

WATCH LIVE: KEYNOTE SPEECH BY SENIOR CABINET MINISTER 

Turn your videos into live streams with Restream https://restre.am/ANIm

So here it is! The post which draws everything together for a group of incredibly resilient, inspiring and talented young people who deserved every single round of applause and two standing ovations on Friday night to celebrate their achievements.

From passing Essential Skills Maths and English qualifications, First Aid at Work Level 3, Food Hygiene, NSPCC Safeguarding, Mental Health Awareness, Self-Care and Wellbeing and even a Driving Theory Test, these amazing young people are starting work on Monday, or courses to progress their education and personal development to progress into jobs of their choosing.

I cannot say enough, and if you've followed their journey, you know I am extremely proud of them and the whole of our  WeMindTheGap team.

This WeGrow Programme never fails to surprise me with what it supports young people to achieve.  

Oh and I did need tissues!

Congratulations to our amazing 10 #Gappies from our Flintshire WeGrow Progamme who have completed their 26 weeks of employment with  WeMindTheGap and Graduated on Friday in front of their friends, family, employer partners, Life Coaches, supporters and the WeMindTheGap team.

It was a huge occasion attended by nearly 100 people who were all their to celebrate their achievements and gave them a standing ovation welcome as they entered the room to their chosen song of 'Here Comes The Sun'.

👏 5 - move straight on into employment on Monday
👏 4 - move into education and training for, Childcare, Teaching Assistant, Film Making and Performing Arts aswell as continuing with volunteering
👏 1 - is considering their next steps

We have so many thankyous for people and organisations that have made this happen:-

Flintshire County Council and Niall Waller who have supported WeMindTheGap since 2016 and #UKSPF funding for enabling this programme to happen.

Our incredible Employer Partners for providing meaningful work placements ClwydAlyn Theatr Clwyd (Tom and team), Wall Lag, Outside Lives, isGroup Signs Plas Newydd Care Ltd Coleg Cambria (Shell), Wepre Park Estates, Aura Leisure, Hawardenestate Wepre Park Primary School, Ysgol Maesglas Greenfield, Cafe Isa, River Link Donkey Sanctuary, Greenacres, Llys Eleanor, Lil Angels, Aura Libraries Cartref Ni Defence Electronics & Components Agency Valto 

Also the incredible kindness, showing our young people different work and life experiences Moneypenny Net World Sports Airbus Aircraft NCAR, 157 (Welsh) Regt RLC Army Reserves, LGBTQ Youth Cymru, Kirsty Craig and Rachel Hough, Moving Forward Fund, TNR Outdoors, Outside Lives, Moreton Hall, Brathay Trust Katie Smithand Matt, Mal Oldfieldand Kate from Pictuehouse. Liz Stanton - GetSafeOnline

We cannot forget to thank our 'Wisdom Filled Superhumans' - Life Coaches, aptly renamed by the Gappies Nathan Sarea, Elaine Rippon, Marian Rosefield MSc (MAPPCP) Ray Smith Nicola Blythin, who guided and inspired our team.

Also the WeMindTheGap Team of Laura Columbine Mark Rimmer and Jim Ellison, not forgetting our wider team and of course Trustees, Rachel Clacher CBE Karen Campbell-Williams Kirsty Rogers Louise Gatenby Karen Jones and Emma Degg FRSA without whom this who programme couldn't have happened.

The evening rounded off a programme of sheer hard work and determination by our young people, and was a celebration non of us will forget.

We can't wait to see what happens next for them all as they stay in touch with us via our Alumni #WeBelong supported by Sian Hughes

#flintshire #employability #socialmobility #UKSPF #graduation
#charity

If you’ve been following the journey of this amazing group of young people over the last 26 weeks you’ll know that tomorrow they graduate.  

I have amazing news to share about their next steps, but for now, below is an overview of their transition week.

Tune in tomorrow for their Graduation …..speech written….note to self….remember glasses and tissues!

From one chapter to another….

Just like the unique young people we support, WeMindTheGap also has many unique elements. One of which is our alumni programme #WeBelong. 

WeBelong is a community where we welcome young people from our WeDiscover and WeGrow programmes to take the next steps to wherever that might be. This could be the world of work, further educational opportunities, volunteering or exploring. Our WeBelong community and team are there to walk alongside our Gappies for however long they need.

During the past couple of weeks, we have spent quality time with our WeGrow Flintshire group as they get ready for their next steps. As part of this transition, we have included these key elements of WeBelong; Employment, Education, Learning and having fun!

So what did we get up to?

For our Fun and Learning element we visited #Liverpool. This involved a train journey, a visit to Liverpool Museum, a walk around the Albert Dock and time to explore Liverpool. We had lots of fun, enjoyed new experiences and loved spending quality time together. Added bonus, the sun was shining too!

The following day we were given our own private tour of Coleg Cambria by our wonderful tutor Shell, who has been leading sessions at our Jade Jones hub during the past 6 months. The tour allowed our Gappies to see the outstanding provision and services available at Coleg Cambria’s Deeside campus and to ease their worries over attending future education and learning opportunities there. 

We then visited Net World Sports in Wrexham and were welcomed by Gareth Davies who gave us an insight into how Networld Sports started, how it’s continuing to expand and what the employment opportunities and benefits they have. We also had a great tour. Thank you to both Shell and Gareth for welcoming us and the time spent with our Gappies.

The week ended with one-to-one sessions with each of our Gappies to hear how we can support them to take their next steps and what element of WeGrow is important for them to continue. It was no surprise to hear that their friendships and the opportunity to see each other was the common theme.

We're excited to welcome our Gappies into the WeBelong community, where they'll find continued support and a network of peers ready to journey alongside them.

Here's to the next chapter and all the adventures it holds!  Thankyou Sian Hughes our WeBelong lead for creating an amazing transition week.

Tomorrow night is #Graduation!!!

#UKSPF #Flintshire #WeGrow #WeBelong #Community

Belonging……my post on belonging got so many responses, I wanted to write some more about it.

So here is the link to my first ever Blog!  https://lnkd.in/dn2QEZSv


The Centre for Social Justice Two Nations report made such an impact on me, and on the back of our  WeMindTheGap Big Conversation findings, where many young people told us that they don’t feel that they belong, that I wanted to share my thoughts on the importance of Belonging in the key area of Education.

For many of the young people we have the pleasure of working with, school and education wasn’t for them!  

Is that because they didn’t feel like they belonged?

Please read my blog and importantly the report, I’d love your thoughts and always happy to debate :-)

ingestedContentSummary.description: Bridging the belonging gap. The Centre for Social Justice’s Two Nations report highlights a nation divided by economic disparity, social mobility barriers and educational inequalities. With children and young people amongst the hardest hit by these...
ingestedContentSummary.title: Reflections on The Centre for Social Justice’s Two Nations report

message.text:
The Centre for Social Justice Two Nations: The State of Poverty in the UK report highlights a nation divided by economic, social and educational inequalities. 

With children and young people amongst the hardest hit by these challenges,  WeMindTheGap’s CEO Ali Wheeler reflects on the role of education in enabling young people to develop a sense of belonging in society.

Read the full news story here: https://lnkd.in/eEYNaHvp

Grrrr missed this amazing experience once again!

I’ll be there in September Katie Smith Teresa Jennings and looking forward to meeting you both in person.

Brathay Trust really do provide our  WeMindTheGap Gappies with life changing experiences,  they never forget their amazing adventures with you, and we are so grateful that you ensure their experiences are challenging and fun!

Last week our Wrexham WeGrow gappies spent 3 days at Brathay Trust  and accomplished so much with the support of Ryan and Cath. This marked the halfway point of their 6-month experience and what a great way to celebrate! 

Our gappies were pushed out of their comfort zones and challenged in ways they have never been challenged with WeMindTheGap before, whilst demonstrating incredible resilience and support for one another. 

We learned the importance of pushing ourselves out of our comfort zones in order to expand them, re-visited the chimp paradox, also discussed the change curve and prisoner to pilot. All of these lessons will help our gappies with any future challenges. 

Huge thank you to Ryan and Cath for this amazing experience and creating a safe space for our young people to challenge and push themselves. 

Huge thanks to Julie Done, Jasmine and Sam from our amazing team too, we know you also faced the challenges alongside our  Gappies 
#UKSPF #wrexham #Charity #socialmobility #outdooreducation #brathaytrust

How do we attract young people into the farming and horticulture industry?   Team up with Rooted & Booted - that’s how!

I really enjoyed hearing about this ‘broadening horizons’ visit for our #WeGrow Wrexham Gappies 

#ukspf #wrexham #employability

The Gappies Return. It has been great to welcome back the latest cohort of young people from WeMindTheGap. Over two days we gave them an insight into farming life, during which they learned about the job opportunities and what it takes to be a farmer. They were a great team who showed real interest and an admirable determination to get stuck in!

Belonging!

What does the word ‘Belonging’ mean to you?

What does ‘Belonging’ feel like for you?

Is it a moment in time?
Is it constant?
What does it involve?

Have you ever felt or experienced a time when you haven’t ‘belonged’.

Does feeling like you ‘Belong’ matter to you?

Yesterday I had the pleasure of speaking at a North Wales #socialprescribing event to share our  WeMindTheGap  Big Conversation findings which we carried out in #wrexham speaking in depth to 18-21yr olds about life in a post Covid world.

I had been asked to share the findings that many young people had shared, about their lack of ‘Belonging’.

Because they don’t feel like they ‘Belong’ they lack purpose, structure and motivation and experience ‘Gaps’ in their lives.

Our report ‘Bridging the gaps, empowering young people across communities, employers and education to enable a brighter future’  and the involvement of Hitch Marketing COM-B behaviour change model outlines that young people need:-

Capacity
Capability
Motivation

Young people told motivation is directly linked to ‘Belonging’.  Belonging in a community, in a group, in a workplace, in education etc

You can develop capabilities and capacity, but without motivation (Belonging) they don’t matter!

So how do we support young people who have fallen through the gaps find ‘Belonging’?

Thoughts?

This is an interesting proposition for anyone who works alongside young people and can help their voice become more influential!  
Alex Hughes Alison Stathers-Tracey Sian Hughes  you maybe interested.

#BeMorePirate was a talk I heard this week at the ACEVO conference- small bold steps!  That’s what we encourage  WeMindTheGap everyday for and alongside our Gappies and WeBelong Alumni graduates.

Exciting Post Alert ⚠⚠️📢🚨⚠️📢🚨 Out of 20,000+ global participants, so far, who had the lowest uncertainty tolerance?

Which demographics in the world’s most extensive study on uncertainty had the lowest scores?

Surprisingly and sadly, it was young people. Specifically, 16 - 25 year olds*

This is upside down; it’s evolutionary that young people should take risks, make mistakes, and adventure to their edges in forming identities.

This is not just a youth issue; as Jonathan Haidt's research shows, young people's catalysing role in society is diminishing, with huge consequences for all our futures.

The Good News is that while their scores start low, their increases are huge; young people show some of the biggest uplifts on the Uncertainty Experts.

Self-belief, Agency, Empathy, Connection, and Risk-Taking ALL Increase long-term**

And so, the Very Exciting Post is that…

Dun, Dun, Dunnnnn….🥁🥁🥁🥁

Uncertainty Experts for Young People has been Green-Lit for research and development! 🚀🖤🚀⚡🚀💀🚀🏴‍☠️🚀 

A pioneering brand dedicated to health and wellness has seen what the support from Netflix and UCL helped us achieve for adults facing uncertainty. 

Now a co-created, updated production with young people is getting underway. Big thanks to them; you know who you are.

So, we're calling for collaborators in the spirit of openness to our experiments in uncertainty.

🤔Are you a young person (or know young people) who’d like to take the course for free to contribute to the research stage of the co-creation process?
❓Do you work in the Youth Sector and have insight into the uncertainty young people face?
🙋🏽Have you completed Uncertainty Experts and have ideas on how it could help young people?
⁉️Are you in the academic or policy end of uncertainty or youth?
📱📺 Are you part of a platform or program that could help this reach young people?


If so, please get in touch below, via DM or hello@uncertaintyexperts.com

And please like, comment, and share for the broadest reach possible.

Thank you to our backers and their brave leader, who’s also been through Uncertainty Experts and is now living up to the promise and potential of the unknown.

Thank you to the 88% of our participants who've nominated young people as the greatest place for possible impact.

Thank you to this team for laying the foundations of something that could be so valuable to so many young people Adam Day-Lewin Kate Brundle Lauren Parmar Jessica Mann Andy Orrick and Katherine Templar Lewis

Particular shout out to BE MORE PIRATE ☠️  and Livity networks, Alex Goat and Alex Barker, if there's any way this can help those communities too.

*No data earlier as Uncertainty Experts is 15/R
**measured six weeks after completion

#UncertaintyExperts #uncertainty #YoungPeople #youthdevelopment #youthempowerment #youthengagement #youth

Honestly bursting with pride for two of our  WeMindTheGap Gappies Carolina and Chloe, and I know Sian Hughes who had the privilege to take them to the House of Commons and watch them take part in a Welsh Select Committee feels the same.

Thankyou to the panel, who listened to them and welcomed them.

If you get the chance to watch the second session, the questions and feedback from the panel shows that they heard and are curious by what they shared, their lived experience, and that matters.  Here is the link https://lnkd.in/eH4aYVrY

1) Consultations with young people rarely reach those outside of traditional statutory pathways - that was recognised!

2) We need new routes to employment for young people not necessarily on the traditional pathway of school or higher education - that was recognised!

3) We need to find and nurture young entrepreneurs - that was recognised!

I learnt a lot from listening to the session, but I also know that our ideas/pilots of an Alternative Employability Hub for young people not in education, employment or training is absolutely needed and is truly exciting.

I will be reaching out to all those involved yesterday to follow up on the the opportunities this has created for our young people to influence, advocate and make change happen for Wales.  It will take us all working together to make it happen.

#ukspf #employability #socialmobility

WeMindTheGap was honoured to address the Welsh Affairs Committee in the House of Commons yesterday, focusing on the factors driving young people to leave Wales and proposing strategies to encourage them to stay. 

Alongside representatives from The Prince's Trust Cymru, our WeBelong Gappies Chloe and Carolina were privileged to represent the young people of North Wales, sharing their lived experiences and insights.

Chaired by Stephen Crabb, the committee of 7 MPs, engaged in a fruitful dialogue with Chloe and Carolina on various critical topics including employment, education opportunities, support for young entrepreneurs, and the barriers hindering these opportunities.

Chloe and Carolina eloquently expressed how WeMindTheGap's WeGrow employability programme has empowered them with invaluable skills and experiences, emphasising the ongoing support provided by the WeBelong alumni programme. 

When asked by the Committee about desired changes, they advocated for improved mental health services for isolated young people and more affordable housing to retain young people in Wales.

Post-session, we participated in discussions as the Committee questioned Walter May, founder of GlobalWelsh, and Robyn Lovelock, Growth Deal Programme Manager Uchelgais Gogledd Cymru | Ambition North Wales, exploring collaborative opportunities.

The Committee commended Chloe and Carolina for their clear, honest and articulate responses, recognising their significant role in influencing policy recommendations at both UK and Welsh government levels.

We are immensely proud of Chloe and Carolina for sharing their experiences, shaping policy discussions, and representing WeMindTheGap on such a prominent platform.

#welshaffairs #populationchange #socialmobility #influencing #youngpeople #rolemodels #ukspf 

Tonia Antoniazzi MP

commentary.text: Amanda Holmes that’s lovely feedback Amanda, we all need to share each others work more, real stories are so powerful.  You only learn so much from watching, hands on experience, and experience of things you may never have tried or will get to try is key.  It takes a special kind of employer to offer meaningful work experience and I think more and more employers are seeing the value in it, not only for young people, but also themselves.
What a lovely thing to do you two x.
Happy Birthday Sam x send us an icecream down to  WeMindTheGap :-)
Thankyou Annabel Turpin we will share with our  WeMindTheGap young people Sian Hughes Laura Columbine
Congratulations to the whole team, what amazing achievement and we are super excited to hear all about it x
Keeping up with your progress, you’re doing amazing!
Congrats and put your feet up!  Amzing amount raised so far for a really important cause x
Sending you climbing vibes, blister busting thoughts and lots of sleep when you can’t wishes!
You will all be amazing and for an amazing cause Karen x
